tools.name: building_widgets_on_openbb
tools.description:
Essential boilerplate code for building OpenBB Workspace widgets. 
    This provides the foundational FastAPI setup, CORS configuration, widgets.json endpoints, 
    and register_widget decorator pattern. ALWAYS call this first when creating OpenBB widgets 
    to get the required boilerplate structure.

tools.name: find_products_single
tools.description: Search the product catalog to find grocery products.IMPORTANT: If the current store_id has a cart_id in the context, use the cart_id to personalize the results.

store_id.description: Store identifier (e.g., '10001' for Loblaws Pickering). Can be obtained from find_store results or from previous select_store calls.

store_name.description: Store name for display in widget. Use this when store_name exist in the context for the current store_id

store_address.description: Store address for display in widget. Use this when store_address exist in the context for the current store_id

cart_id.description: Cart ID for personalized results. Use this when cart_id exist in the context for the current store_id. If not provided, a new cart will be created automatically.

num_results.description: Number of top results to return

banner.description: Optional banner name for store display in widget. The available banners are: ['FORTINOS', 'INDEPENDENT', 'INDEPENDENTCITYMARKET', 'LOBLAW', 'MAXI', 'NOFRILLS', 'PROVIGO', 'RASS', 'SUPERSTORE', 'VALUMART', 'ZEHRS'].

tools.name: find_products_multiple
tools.description: Search the product catalog for multiple keywords in parallel. Returns results for each search term.IMPORTANT: If the current store_id has a cart_id in the context, use the cart_id to personalize the results.

terms.description: List of search terms for finding products

store_id.description: Store identifier (e.g., '10001' for Loblaws Pickering). Can be obtained from find_store results or from previous select_store calls.

store_name.description: Store name for display in widget. Use this when store_name exist in the context for the current store_id

store_address.description: Store address for display in widget. Use this when store_address exist in the context for the current store_id

cart_id.description: Cart ID for personalized results. Use this when cart_id exist in the context for the current store_id. If not provided, a new cart will be created automatically.

banner.description: Optional banner name for store display in widget. The available banners are: ['FORTINOS', 'INDEPENDENT', 'INDEPENDENTCITYMARKET', 'LOBLAW', 'MAXI', 'NOFRILLS', 'PROVIGO', 'RASS', 'SUPERSTORE', 'VALUMART', 'ZEHRS'].

tools.name: find_store
tools.description: Find nearby stores for a given postal code using the serviceability API. REQUIRES: postal code and banners. The available banners are: ['FORTINOS', 'INDEPENDENT', 'INDEPENDENTCITYMARKET', 'LOBLAW', 'MAXI', 'NOFRILLS', 'PROVIGO', 'RASS', 'SUPERSTORE', 'VALUMART', 'ZEHRS']. fulfillment_type is always PICKUP (the only available option) and should not be asked from the user. The LLM MUST ask the user for postal code and banner if not already provided. IMPORTANT: After calling this tool, the UI will display the store information. The LLM MUST inform the user that stores are displayed above and ask them to select one store from the displayed list.

postal_code.description: Postal code to search nearby stores (e.g., 'M5V 0R9'). REQUIRED: Ask the user if not provided.

fulfillment_type.description: Type of fulfillment: PICKUP is the only available fulfillment type. This parameter must always be set to 'PICKUP' as it is the only option defined in the FulfillmentType enum. PICKUP uses bifrost API. Do not ask the user for this parameter - always use 'PICKUP'.

banner.description: Banner filter: the available banners are: ['FORTINOS', 'INDEPENDENT', 'INDEPENDENTCITYMARKET', 'LOBLAW', 'MAXI', 'NOFRILLS', 'PROVIGO', 'RASS', 'SUPERSTORE', 'VALUMART', 'ZEHRS']. REQUIRED: Ask the user which banner/store brand they prefer if not provided.

tools.name: select_store
tools.description: Select a store to use for subsequent product searches and cart operations. PREREQUISITE: This tool MUST be called FIRST before calling find_products_single or find_products_multiple. This tool creates a cart and returns a cart_id that is REQUIRED for all product search tools. WORKFLOW: This is step 2 in the shopping flow. 1) Call select_store with store_id, postal_code, fulfillment_type (PICKUP), and banner to get cart_id. 2) Use the returned cart_id in all subsequent find_products_single/find_products_multiple calls. OUTPUT: Returns a cart_id that MUST be extracted and used in find_products tools. IMPORTANT: Do NOT show cart_id to the user - it is an internal identifier. The LLM MUST remember this selection: store_id, cart_id, fulfillment_type, and banner. CRITICAL: Maintain a mapping of store_id → {cart_id, banner, fulfillment_type} in conversation context. Each store_id can have one associated cart_id. When user switches stores, check if a cart exists for that store_id. If switching to a previously selected store, inform user about existing cart or ask permission to create new one. IMPORTANT: When switching stores with different banners (e.g., from loblaw to nofrills), ensure the banner is updated in the context mapping. Banner is required for cart creation. REQUIRES: store_id, postal_code, fulfillment_type (PICKUP), and banner. The available banners are: ['FORTINOS', 'INDEPENDENT', 'INDEPENDENTCITYMARKET', 'LOBLAW', 'MAXI', 'NOFRILLS', 'PROVIGO', 'RASS', 'SUPERSTORE', 'VALUMART', 'ZEHRS']. The LLM MUST ask the user for banner if not already provided. fulfillment_type is always PICKUP (the only available option) and should not be asked from the user.

store_id.description: Store ID to select (e.g., '1424' from find_store results). REQUIRED.

postal_code.description: Postal code to select for PICKUP fulfillment. REQUIRED.

fulfillment_type.description: Type of fulfillment: PICKUP is the only available fulfillment type. This parameter must always be set to 'PICKUP' as it is the only option defined in the FulfillmentType enum. Do not ask the user for this parameter - always use 'PICKUP'.

banner.description: Banner filter: the available banners are: ['FORTINOS', 'INDEPENDENT', 'INDEPENDENTCITYMARKET', 'LOBLAW', 'MAXI', 'NOFRILLS', 'PROVIGO', 'RASS', 'SUPERSTORE', 'VALUMART', 'ZEHRS']. REQUIRED: Ask the user which banner/store brand they prefer if not provided.

store_info.description: Optional store information (name, address, etc.) from find_store results

tools.name: create_cart_with_products
tools.description: Create a shopping cart and optionally add products to it. WORKFLOW: This is step 3 in the shopping flow. Use this tool when: - User says 'add all to cart', 'add these to cart', or 'add to cart' - User wants to add products from previous search results - User clicks 'add all to cart' button in the UI - User wants to create an empty cart (items can be None or empty) BEFORE CALLING: Check if a cart already exists in the context for the current store_id. If cart exists in the context for this store_id, use add_products_to_cart instead. If no cart exists, create one with this tool. AFTER CREATION: Store the returned cart_id and link it to the store_id in conversation context. IMPORTANT: When switching stores with different banners, ensure banner is updated in context. REQUIRED: fulfillment_type (PICKUP), store_id, banner (from select_store). OPTIONAL: items (product LIAMs from search results) - if None or empty, creates an empty cart. The LLM MUST ask user for missing required parameters.

fulfillment_type.description: Fulfillment type: PICKUP is the only available fulfillment type. This parameter must always be set to 'PICKUP' as it is the only option defined in the FulfillmentType enum. Use the fulfillment_type from previous select_store call, or always use 'PICKUP' if not available. Do not ask the user for this parameter - always use 'PICKUP'.

store_id.description: Store ID (e.g., '1028'). REQUIRED: Use the store_id from previous select_store call, or ask the user if not available. IMPORTANT: Before creating cart, check if a cart already exists for this store_id.

banner.description: Banner ID (e.g., 'loblaw'). REQUIRED: Use the banner from previous select_store call, or ask the user which banner they prefer if not available. IMPORTANT: When switching stores, ensure banner matches the new store's banner.

anyOf.description: Dictionary mapping LIAM → quantity (must be positive integers >= 1). Example: {'21080961_EA': 2, '20049778001_EA': 1}

items.description: Dictionary mapping LIAM → quantity (must be positive integers >= 1). Example: {'21080961_EA': 2, '20049778001_EA': 1}. OPTIONAL: Extract LIAMs from previous product search results (find_products_single/find_products_multiple). When user says 'add all to cart', include all products from the search results. If None or empty, creates an empty cart (no products added).

postal_code.description: Postal code (not required for PICKUP fulfillment). OPTIONAL: Not needed for PICKUP.

tools.name: add_products_to_cart
tools.description: Add multiple products to an EXISTING cart using batch UPDATE operation. USE THIS TOOL when: - User wants to add more products to an already created cart - A cart_id already exists for the current store_id (from conversation context) - User says 'add more items' or 'add these to my cart' and a cart exists BEFORE CALLING: If the current store_id has a cart_id in the context, use this tool. If NO cart_id exists for this store_id in the context, use create_cart_with_products instead. REQUIRED: cart_id (from conversation context or previous cart creation), store_id, and items.

cart_id.description: Cart ID of the existing cart to add products to. REQUIRED: Get cart_id from conversation context (store_id → cart_id mapping), or from previous cart creation response. If cart_id not found for current store_id, use create_cart_with_products instead.

store_id.description: Store ID (e.g., '1028'). REQUIRED: Use the store_id from previous select_store call, or from conversation context. Must match the store_id associated with the cart_id.

anyOf.description: Dictionary mapping LIAM → quantity (must be positive integers >= 1). Example: {'21080961_EA': 2, '20049778001_EA': 1}

items.description: Dictionary mapping LIAM → quantity (must be positive integers >= 1). Example: {'21080961_EA': 2, '20049778001_EA': 1}. REQUIRED: Extract LIAMs from product search results. If None or empty, the operation is skipped and current cart state is returned.

tools.name: remove_products_from_cart
tools.description: Remove multiple products from an existing cart. REQUIRED: cart_id (from conversation context: store_id → cart_id mapping). Products are removed based on specified quantities. If a product doesn't have enough quantity, that removal will fail but others will proceed.

cart_id.description: Cart ID of the existing cart to remove products from. REQUIRED: Get cart_id from conversation context (store_id → cart_id mapping), or from previous cart creation response.

store_id.description: Store ID (e.g., '1028'). REQUIRED: Use the store_id from previous select_store call or conversation context.

anyOf.description: Dictionary mapping LIAM → quantity (must be positive integers >= 1). Example: {'21080961_EA': 2, '20049778001_EA': 1}

items.description: Dictionary mapping LIAM → quantity to remove (must be positive integers >= 1). Example: {'21080961_EA': 2, '20049778001_EA': 1}. If None or empty, the operation is skipped and current cart state is returned. If a product doesn't have enough quantity, that removal will fail but others will proceed.

tools.name: update_products_in_cart
tools.description: Update quantities of multiple products in an existing cart using batch UPDATE operation. REQUIRED: cart_id (from conversation context: store_id → cart_id mapping). The quantity specified is the NEW quantity to set (not added to existing).

cart_id.description: Cart ID of the existing cart to update. REQUIRED: Get cart_id from conversation context (store_id → cart_id mapping), or from previous cart creation response.

store_id.description: Store ID (e.g., '1028'). REQUIRED: Use the store_id from previous select_store call or conversation context.

anyOf.description: Dictionary mapping LIAM → quantity (must be non-negative integers >= 0). Quantity 0 means remove all of that product. Example: {'21080961_EA': 20, '20049778001_EA': 5}

items.description: Dictionary mapping LIAM → quantity (must be non-negative integers >= 0). Example: {'21080961_EA': 20, '20049778001_EA': 5}. The quantity is the NEW quantity to set (not added to existing). A quantity of 0 means remove all of that product. If None or empty, the operation is skipped and current cart state is returned.

tools.name: get_cart
tools.description: Get information for an existing shopping cart including items with enriched metadata (images, names, brands, prices). REQUIRED: cart_id (from conversation context: store_id → cart_id mapping). Use this tool when user asks to view their cart or see what's in their cart.

cart_id.description: Cart ID of the existing cart to retrieve. REQUIRED: Get cart_id from conversation context (store_id → cart_id mapping), or from previous cart creation response. If user asks about cart for current store, check store_id → cart_id mapping.

tools.name: clear_cart
tools.description: Remove all products from an existing shopping cart, leaving it empty. REQUIRED: cart_id (from conversation context: store_id → cart_id mapping). Use this tool when user wants to empty their cart or start over.

cart_id.description: Cart ID of the cart to clear. REQUIRED: Get cart_id from conversation context (store_id → cart_id mapping), or from previous cart creation response.

tools.name: memory_store
tools.description: Create memories with observations and relationships. **Pattern**: Search→Create→Connect. **Observations**: Self-contained context units (what/when/where/why/impact). **LocalIds**: Cross-references within THIS request only. **Limits**: 50 memories, 200 relations. **Quality**: Each observation = complete detective notes answering setting/action/actors/evidence/impact/significance.

name.description: Human-readable identifier. Be specific: 'OAuth2 Implementation' not 'Auth'. Include searchable keywords.

memoryType.description: Category: knowledge (facts), decision (choices), issue (problems), implementation (code), architecture (structure), pattern (recurring solutions), insight (discoveries).

localId.description: Temporary ID for relations within THIS request. Not reusable across operations. Format: short descriptive names.

observations.description: Context-rich narratives. Each = complete story with setting/action/actors/evidence/impact/significance. **One insight per session** - don't fragment thoughts.

metadata.description: Static properties (JSON). Use for: project, language, status, tags, dates, version. **Narrative content goes in observations**.

memories.description: Array of memories to create. **Always search first** to avoid duplicates. Each memory = one focused concept.

type.description: Relationship type: INFLUENCES, DEPENDS_ON, EXTENDS, IMPLEMENTS, CONTAINS, etc.

relations.description: Connect memories: from/to (localId or memoryId), type (semantic meaning), strength (0.1-1.0 importance).

validateReferences.description: Check all target IDs exist (default: true)

options.description: Store options

tools.name: memory_find
tools.description: Unified search/retrieval. **Query**: text, IDs array, or "*". **Context**: minimal (lists), full (everything), relations-only (graph). **Temporal**: createdAfter "7d"/"2024-01-15". **Graph**: traverseFrom + relations + depth. **Always search before creating**. Updates access timestamps for analytics.

query.description: Search text, array of memory IDs, or '*' for all. **Semantic search**: finds meaning, not just keywords.

limit.description: Max results (default: 10). **Increase for comprehensive searches** - use 50+ for full exploration.

memoryTypes.description: Filter by type array. **Leave empty for all types**. Common: ['knowledge', 'decision', 'implementation'].

includeContext.description: Detail level: **minimal** (id/name/type only - for lists), **full** (everything - default work mode), **relations-only** (graph analysis only).

threshold.description: Semantic match minimum (0.1-1.0). **Lower = more results**. 0.1 = permissive, 0.8 = strict matching.

createdAfter.description: Date filter. **ISO** ('2024-01-15') or **relative** ('7d', '30d', '3m', '1y'). Finds recent additions.

traverseFrom.description: Memory ID to start graph exploration. **Discovers connected knowledge** through relationships.

traverseRelations.description: Relation types to follow. **Empty = all types**. Common: ['INFLUENCES', 'DEPENDS_ON', 'IMPLEMENTS'].

maxDepth.description: Graph traversal depth (1-5, default: 2). **Higher = broader discovery**, but slower performance.

tools.name: memory_modify
tools.description: Update/delete memories, manage observations/relations. **Operations**: update (properties), delete (cascade), add-observations (append insights), create-relations (link existing). **Atomic**: All succeed or all fail. **Quality**: One substantial observation per session - complete context stories, not fragments.

target.description: Single memory ID to modify. **Use 'targets' for batch operations** to maintain atomicity.

name.description: New memory name

changes.description: For update: new name/type/metadata. **Preserves existing observations** - use add-observations to append.

contents.description: For add: new observation text(s) - **typically one per session**. For delete: observation IDs to remove.

observations.description: For add-observations: new insights to append. **One substantial observation per session** - complete context stories.

type.description: Relationship type: INFLUENCES, DEPENDS_ON, EXTENDS, IMPLEMENTS, CONTAINS, etc.

relations.description: Relationships to create/update/delete between existing memories.

validateObservationIds.description: Validate observation IDs for delete (default: true)

options.description: Modify options

tools.name: database_switch
tools.description: Switch active database context (creates if missing). ALL subsequent operations use this DB. Call once per session/project. Like 'cd' for memories. **Session-scoped**: Establishes context for entire workflow, not per-operation.

databaseName.description: Target database name. **Will be created if doesn't exist**. Use project names for isolation.

tools.name: lokalise_list_key_comments
tools.description: Retrieves all comments for a specific translation key to understand discussion history and context. Required: projectId, keyId. Optional: limit (100), page. Use this to review translator questions, see implementation notes, or audit collaboration on a specific key. Returns: Paginated list of comments with author, timestamp, and content. Pairs with: lokalise_create_comments to continue discussions.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the key

keyId.description: Key ID to list comments for

limit.description: Number of comments to return (1-5000, default: 100)

tools.name: lokalise_list_project_comments
tools.description: Fetches all comments across an entire project for a comprehensive overview of team collaboration. Required: projectId. Optional: limit (100), page. Use this to identify keys with active discussions, audit communication patterns, or find unresolved questions. Returns: Comments grouped by key with context. Note: Can be data-intensive for large projects.

projectId.description: Project ID to list all comments for

limit.description: Number of comments to return (1-5000, default: 100)

tools.name: lokalise_get_comment
tools.description: Gets full details of a single comment including complete text and metadata. Required: projectId, keyId, commentId. Use when comment text was truncated in list view or to get exact timestamps. Returns: Complete comment data with author details and creation time. Pairs with: lokalise_delete_comment for comment management.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the comment

commentId.description: Comment ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_create_comments
tools.description: Adds one or more comments to a translation key for team collaboration. Required: projectId, keyId, comments array with 'comment' text. Use to ask translators questions, provide context, leave implementation notes, or flag issues. Supports bulk creation for efficiency. Returns: Created comments with IDs. Note: Comments are visible to all project members.

projectId.description: Project ID to create comments in

keyId.description: Key ID to attach comments to

tools.name: lokalise_delete_comment
tools.description: Permanently removes a specific comment from a translation key. Required: projectId, keyId, commentId. Use to clean up resolved discussions, remove outdated information, or delete accidental comments. Returns: Confirmation of deletion. Warning: This action cannot be undone. Consider archiving important discussions elsewhere first.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the comment

tools.name: lokalise_list_contributors
tools.description: Lists all team members in a project with their roles and permissions. Required: projectId. Optional: limit (100), page. Use to audit team access, check language assignments, or prepare permission changes. Returns: Contributors with email, role, admin status, and language permissions. Use before adding new members to avoid duplicates.

projectId.description: Project ID to list contributors for

limit.description: Number of contributors to return (1-100, default: 100)

tools.name: lokalise_get_contributor
tools.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific team member's access and permissions. Required: projectId, contributorId. Use to verify exact permissions before updates, investigate access issues, or get complete language assignments. Returns: Full contributor profile including all language permissions and administrative rights.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the contributor

contributorId.description: Contributor ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_add_contributors
tools.description: Onboards one or more new team members to a project. Required: projectId, contributors array with email and permissions (admin_rights, is_reviewer, languages). Use for team expansion, granting translator access, or adding reviewers. Returns: Added contributors with assigned IDs. Note: Sends invitation emails automatically.

projectId.description: Project ID to add contributors to

tools.name: lokalise_get_current_user
tools.description: Checks your own permissions and access level in a project. Required: projectId. Use to verify your administrative capabilities, check language access, or confirm reviewer status before attempting restricted operations. Returns: Your contributor profile with all permissions. Essential before permission-sensitive operations.

projectId.description: Project ID to get current user's contributor profile

tools.name: lokalise_update_contributor
tools.description: Modifies a team member's role, permissions, or language access. Required: projectId, contributorId. Optional: admin_rights, is_reviewer, languages array. Use to promote/demote users, adjust language assignments, or fix permission issues. Returns: Updated contributor profile. Note: Cannot modify your own admin rights.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the contributor

tools.name: lokalise_remove_contributor
tools.description: Removes a team member from a project, revoking all access. Required: projectId, contributorId. Use for offboarding, security cleanup, or removing inactive members. Returns: Confirmation of removal. Warning: Immediate effect - contributor loses all project access. Consider permission downgrade instead for temporary changes.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the contributor

tools.name: lokalise_list_glossary_terms
tools.description: Retrieves paginated glossary terms that define translation rules for consistency. Required: projectId. Optional: limit (100), cursor for pagination. Use to discover defined terminology including brand names, technical terms, and forbidden words. Returns: Terms with properties (case-sensitive, translatable, forbidden) and translations. Essential before translating to prevent terminology errors.

projectId.description: Project ID to list glossary terms for

limit.description: Number of glossary terms to return (1-5000, default: 100)

cursor.description: Cursor for pagination. Use nextCursor from previous response

tools.name: lokalise_get_glossary_term
tools.description: Fetches complete details for a single glossary term by ID. Required: projectId, termId. Use to understand precise translation rules, check case-sensitivity requirements, or view all language translations for a term. Returns: Full term data including definition, properties, and language-specific translations. Critical for translator guidance.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the glossary term

termId.description: Glossary term ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_create_glossary_terms
tools.description: Adds new terminology rules to maintain translation consistency. Required: projectId, terms array with {term, definition}. Optional per term: case_sensitive, translatable, forbidden, translations by language. Use for brand names, technical jargon, or untranslatable terms. Returns: Created terms with IDs. Supports bulk creation up to 1000 terms.

projectId.description: Project ID to create glossary terms in

term.description: The glossary term text (e.g., brand name, technical term)

description.description: Description or definition of the term

caseSensitive.description: Whether term matching should be case-sensitive

translatable.description: Whether the term can be translated or should remain unchanged

forbidden.description: Whether this term should be flagged as forbidden in translations

translation.description: The translated term in the specified language

description.description: Description or context for the translation

translations.description: Translations of the term in different languages

terms.description: Array of glossary terms to create (supports bulk creation)

tools.name: lokalise_update_glossary_terms
tools.description: Modifies existing glossary definitions and properties. Required: projectId, terms array with {term_id} plus changes. Use to refine definitions, add language translations, or adjust rules (case-sensitivity, forbidden status). Returns: Updated terms. Supports bulk updates. Changes apply immediately to all future translations.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the glossary terms

id.description: The ID of the glossary term to update

translation.description: The translated term in the specified language

description.description: Description or context for the translation

terms.description: Array of glossary terms to update (supports bulk updates)

tools.name: lokalise_delete_glossary_terms
tools.description: Removes obsolete or incorrect glossary entries. Required: projectId, termIds array. Use to clean up outdated terminology, remove duplicates, or fix mistakes. Returns: Deletion confirmation. Warning: Removes all term translations and rules. Supports bulk deletion. Consider updating instead of deleting for audit trail.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the glossary terms

termIds.description: Array of glossary term IDs to delete (supports bulk deletion)

tools.name: lokalise_list_keys
tools.description: Explores the project's content structure by listing translation keys. Required: projectId. Optional: limit (100), cursor, filterKeys array, filterPlatforms array, includeTranslations. Use to browse content organization, find specific keys, or audit platform coverage. Returns: Keys with metadata and optional translations. Supports cursor pagination for large projects. Start here to understand project content.

projectId.description: Project ID to list keys for

limit.description: Number of keys to return (1-5000, default: 100)

includeTranslations.description: Include translation data for each key

filterPlatforms.description: Filter by platforms (ios, android, web, other)

tools.name: lokalise_create_keys
tools.description: Adds new UI text or content to be translated (up to 1000 keys per request). Required: projectId, keys array with {key_name, platforms}. Optional per key: description, tags, translations. Use for new features, initial setup, or content expansion. Returns: Created keys with IDs and any errors. Tip: Include base language translations to speed up workflow. Pairs with: lokalise_list_keys to verify.

projectId.description: Project ID to create keys in

keys.description: Array of key objects to create (1-1000 keys)

tools.name: lokalise_get_key
tools.description: Deep-dives into a single content item to understand its complete state. Required: projectId, keyId. Use to investigate translation status, view all language versions, check metadata, or debug issues. Returns: Full key data including all translations, platforms, tags, comments, and history. Essential for detailed analysis or before making targeted updates.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the key

keyId.description: Key ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_update_key
tools.description: Modifies key metadata to improve organization and translator context. Required: projectId, keyId. Optional: key_name, description, platforms, tags. Use to clarify meaning for translators, fix platform assignments, or reorganize content. Returns: Updated key. Note: This updates metadata only - use translation tools to modify actual text. Changes apply immediately.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the key

tools.name: lokalise_delete_key
tools.description: Permanently removes obsolete content and all its translations. Required: projectId, keyId. Use for removing deprecated features, cleaning typos in key names, or content no longer needed. Returns: Deletion confirmation. Warning: Irreversible - all translations lost. Consider archiving important content first. For multiple keys, use bulk delete.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the key

tools.name: lokalise_bulk_update_keys
tools.description: Efficiently modifies metadata for multiple keys in one operation. Required: projectId, keys array with {key_id} plus changes. Use for large-scale reorganization, batch platform updates, or systematic tagging. Returns: Updated keys and any errors. Performance: Processes up to 1000 keys per request. More efficient than individual updates for 3+ keys.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the keys

tools.name: lokalise_bulk_delete_keys
tools.description: Large-scale cleanup removing multiple obsolete keys permanently. Required: projectId, keyIds array. Use for removing deprecated feature sets, post-refactoring cleanup, or major content pruning. Returns: Deletion results. Critical Warning: Irreversible batch operation - all selected keys and translations permanently deleted. Always verify key list before execution.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the keys

keyIds.description: Array of key IDs to delete (1-1000 keys)

tools.name: lokalise_list_system_languages
tools.description: Discovers all languages available in Lokalise platform that can be added to projects. Optional: limit (100), page. Use to find supported languages before project setup, verify language codes, or check RTL/plural form support. Returns: Languages with ISO codes, native names, RTL status, plural forms. Essential before adding new target languages.

limit.description: Number of languages to return (1-500, default: 100)

tools.name: lokalise_list_project_languages
tools.description: Shows which languages are currently being translated in a project. Required: projectId. Optional: includeProgress (shows completion %), limit, page. Use to audit translation coverage, identify incomplete languages, or prepare reports. Returns: Active languages with progress stats. Start here to understand project's localization scope.

projectId.description: Project ID to list languages for

includeProgress.description: Include translation progress percentages for each language

tools.name: lokalise_add_project_languages
tools.description: Starts translating into new languages by adding them to the project. Required: projectId, languages array with {lang_iso}. Optional per language: custom_iso, custom_name, custom_plural_forms. Use when expanding to new markets or adding regional variants. Returns: Added languages with IDs. Tip: Check system languages first for valid ISO codes.

projectId.description: Project ID to add languages to

languages.description: Array of language objects to add (1-100 languages)

tools.name: lokalise_get_language
tools.description: Examines detailed settings for a specific project language. Required: projectId, languageId. Use to verify plural rules, check RTL configuration, or understand custom settings. Returns: Complete language configuration including ISO codes, plural forms, and writing direction. Important for languages with complex grammar rules.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the language

languageId.description: Language ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_update_language
tools.description: Modifies language settings within a project. Required: projectId, languageId, languageData object. Optional in data: lang_iso, lang_name, plural_forms. Use to fix incorrect configurations, customize language names, or adjust plural rules. Returns: Updated language settings. Changes affect how translations are handled.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the language

tools.name: lokalise_remove_language
tools.description: Drops support for a language by removing it from the project. Required: projectId, languageId. Use when discontinuing localization for a market or cleaning up test languages. Returns: Removal confirmation. Critical Warning: Permanently deletes ALL translations for this language. Export translations first if needed.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the language

tools.name: lokalise_list_projects
tools.description: Portfolio overview showing all accessible localization projects. Optional: limit (100), page, includeStats (adds progress/QA data). Use as entry point to discover projects, assess translation health, or find specific project IDs. Returns: Projects with names, IDs, base language, stats. Start here before diving into specific projects.

limit.description: Number of projects to return (1-500, default: 100)

tools.name: lokalise_get_project
tools.description: Deep analysis of a single project's health and configuration. Required: projectId. Optional: includeLanguages (completion rates), includeKeysSummary (content stats). Use for project audits, progress reports, or understanding structure. Returns: Complete project metadata, team info, language progress, key statistics. Essential for project status assessment.

projectId.description: Project ID to get details for

includeLanguages.description: Include detailed language information and completion rates

includeKeysSummary.description: Include summary of keys (total, translated, missing)

tools.name: lokalise_create_project
tools.description: Initializes a new localization project for an app or service. Required: name. Optional: description, base_lang_iso (default 'en'). Use when starting localization for new products or creating test environments. Returns: Project ID and access details. Next steps: Add languages, upload keys, invite team members.

name.description: Name of the project to create

lang_iso.description: Language ISO code to initialize in the project

languages.description: Initial project languages. If provided, should include base_lang_iso when base language is not 'en'

tools.name: lokalise_update_project
tools.description: Modifies project settings and metadata. Required: projectId, projectData object. Optional in data: name, description. Use to rename projects, update descriptions, or fix project information. Returns: Updated project details. Note: Only changes metadata - use other tools for content/language changes.

projectId.description: Project ID to update

name.description: Updated project name

tools.name: lokalise_delete_project
tools.description: Permanently destroys a project and ALL its data. Required: projectId. Use for removing test projects or discontinued products. Returns: Deletion confirmation. CRITICAL WARNING: Irreversible - deletes all keys, translations, history, and team assignments. Export data first if needed. Consider emptying instead.

projectId.description: Project ID to delete

tools.name: lokalise_empty_project
tools.description: Resets project content while preserving settings and team. Required: projectId. Use for major refactoring, starting fresh, or clearing test data. Returns: Operation confirmation. Effect: Removes all keys and translations but keeps languages, team, and project configuration. Safer alternative to deletion.

projectId.description: Project ID to empty

tools.name: lokalise_list_queued_processes
tools.description: Lists all background/async processes in a Lokalise project with status tracking. Required: projectId. Optional: limit (100), page. Use to monitor file uploads, downloads, bulk operations, or troubleshoot process issues. Returns: Processes with status, progress, and completion estimates.

projectId.description: Project ID to list queued processes for (supports branch notation: projectId:branchName)

limit.description: Number of processes to return (1-100, default: 100)

tools.name: lokalise_get_queued_process
tools.description: Gets detailed status and information about a specific async process (upload, download, etc.). Required: projectId, processId. Use to check process completion, diagnose failures, or get detailed progress information. Returns: Complete process details with logs and status history.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the process

processId.description: Process ID to get details for (unique string identifier)

tools.name: lokalise_list_tasks
tools.description: Monitors ongoing translation work and deadlines across the project. Required: projectId. Optional: filterTitle, filterStatuses array, limit (50), page. Use to track workload, find overdue tasks, or check assignment status. Returns: Tasks with assignees, progress, due dates, and language scope. Essential for project management and workflow monitoring.

projectId.description: Project ID to list tasks for

limit.description: Number of tasks to return (1-500, default: 100)

filterStatuses.description: Filter by task statuses (new, in_progress, completed, closed, cancelled)

tools.name: lokalise_create_task
tools.description: Initiates a new batch of translation or review work. Required: projectId, title, languages array. Optional: description, due_date, assignees (applies to all languages), type (translation/review), keys scope. Use to assign work to translators, set deadlines, or organize sprints. Returns: Created task with ID and assignments. Tip: Use assignees for simple same-user-all-languages setup.

projectId.description: Project ID to create task in

keys.description: Array of key IDs to include in this task. Only provide if you want to limit the task to specific keys. Leave empty to include all project keys

users.description: User IDs assigned to this language. Either 'users' or 'groups' must be specified, unless using top-level 'assignees'

groups.description: Group IDs assigned to this language. Either 'users' or 'groups' must be specified, unless using top-level 'assignees'

languages.description: Languages with specific user/group assignments. Each language MUST have either 'users' or 'groups' specified, unless you use the top-level 'assignees' parameter

assignees.description: User IDs to assign to ALL languages in the task. This is a convenience parameter - if specified, these users will be assigned to every language in the task. Use this OR specify users/groups per language, not both

due_date.description: Due date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS)

auto_close_task.description: Auto-close task when all languages completed

task_type.description: Type of task: 'translation' (human translation work), 'review' (quality review by editors), 'automatic_translation' (AI-powered machine translation with human review), 'lqa_by_ai' (AI-powered linguistic quality assurance). Choose based on workflow needs - translation for new content, review for quality control, automatic_translation for speed with oversight, lqa_by_ai for AI translation with quality checks

closing_tags.description: Tags that close the task when applied

do_lock_translations.description: Lock translations when task is created

tools.name: lokalise_get_task
tools.description: Investigates a specific work assignment in detail. Required: projectId, taskId. Use to check task progress, view assignee workload, or debug workflow issues. Returns: Complete task data including all assignments, completion percentages, settings, and history. Pairs with: lokalise_update_task for modifications.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the task

taskId.description: Task ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_update_task
tools.description: Modifies an active work assignment. Required: projectId, taskId. Optional: title, description, due_date, language assignments, settings. Use to extend deadlines, reassign work, or update scope. Returns: Updated task details. Note: Cannot change task type after creation. Changes notify assignees automatically.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the task

due_date.description: Updated due date in ISO format

users.description: User IDs assigned to this language. Either 'users' or 'groups' must be specified, unless using top-level 'assignees'

groups.description: Group IDs assigned to this language. Either 'users' or 'groups' must be specified, unless using top-level 'assignees'

auto_close_task.description: Auto-close task when all languages completed

closing_tags.description: Tags that close the task when applied

tools.name: lokalise_delete_task
tools.description: Cancels a work assignment, removing it from assignee queues. Required: projectId, taskId. Use to cancel mistaken tasks, clean completed work, or remove test assignments. Returns: Deletion confirmation. Note: Only removes the assignment - keys and translations remain unchanged. Cannot be undone.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the task

tools.name: lokalise_list_team_users
tools.description: Lists all users in a Lokalise team with pagination support. Required: teamId. Optional: limit (100), page. Use to audit team composition, check access levels, or prepare team changes. Returns: Users with roles, permissions, and activity status.

teamId.description: Team ID to list users for

limit.description: Number of users to return (1-100, default: 100)

tools.name: lokalise_get_team_user
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific user in a team. Required: teamId, userId. Use to verify user permissions, check role assignments, or investigate access issues. Returns: Complete user profile with all team permissions and administrative rights.

userId.description: User ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_update_team_user
tools.description: Updates a team user's role (owner, admin, member, or biller). Required: teamId, userId, role. Use to manage permissions, promote/demote, or adjust access levels. Returns: Updated user profile with new role and permissions.

tools.name: lokalise_delete_team_user
tools.description: Removes a user from a Lokalise team. Required: teamId, userId. Use to remove members, clean up permissions, or manage team structure. Returns: Success message with user details.

tools.name: lokalise_list_translations
tools.description: Low-level inspection of actual translated text across languages. Required: projectId. Optional: limit (100), cursor, filterLangId, filterIsReviewed, filterQaIssues. Use for quality audits, finding untranslated content, or checking specific language progress. Returns: Translation entries with content, status, QA flags. Note: Different from keys - this shows actual text.

projectId.description: Project ID to list translations for

limit.description: Number of translations to return (1-5000, default: 100)

filterLangId.description: Filter by language ID (numeric, not ISO code)

filterUntranslated.description: Filter by translation status (1=show only untranslated)

tools.name: lokalise_get_translation
tools.description: Examines a single piece of translated text in detail. Required: projectId, translationId. Use to check exact wording, review status, modification history, or investigate QA issues. Returns: Complete translation data including content, reviewer info, timestamps, and quality flags. Essential for translation debugging.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the translation

translationId.description: Translation ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_update_translation
tools.description: Modifies actual translated text or its review status. Required: projectId, translationId. Optional: translation (new text), is_reviewed, is_unverified. Use to fix typos, approve translations, or mark problematic content. Returns: Updated translation. Note: Changes visible immediately to all users.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the translation

customTranslationStatusIds.description: Array of custom translation status IDs (numeric)

tools.name: lokalise_bulk_update_translations
tools.description: Efficiently processes batch translation corrections or approvals. Required: projectId, updates array (up to 100). Each update needs translation_id plus changes. Use for mass approvals, systematic corrections, or importing reviewed content. Returns: Success/error per translation. Performance: ~5 updates/second with automatic rate limiting and retries.

projectId.description: Project ID containing the translations

customTranslationStatusIds.description: Array of custom translation status IDs (numeric)

updates.description: Array of translation updates (min 1, max 100). Each update includes translationId and translationData

tools.name: lokalise_list_usergroups
tools.description: Lists all user groups in a Lokalise team with pagination support. Required: teamId. Optional: limit (100), page. Use to audit team organization, check group structure, or prepare group management operations. Returns: User groups with names, member counts, permissions, and language assignments. Essential for understanding team hierarchy.

teamId.description: Team ID to list user groups for

limit.description: Number of user groups to return (1-100, default: 100)

tools.name: lokalise_get_usergroup
tools.description: Gets detailed information about a specific user group including members, permissions, and project assignments. Required: teamId, groupId. Use to audit group configuration, verify member access, or understand permission structure. Returns: Complete group profile with admin rights, language permissions, and assigned projects/members.

teamId.description: Team ID containing the user group

groupId.description: User group ID to get details for

tools.name: lokalise_create_usergroup
tools.description: Creates a new user group in a Lokalise team for organized permission management. Required: teamId, name, isReviewer, isAdmin. Optional: adminRights, languages, projects, members. Use to establish role-based access control, organize team permissions, or set up project-specific groups. Returns: Created group with assigned ID and configuration.

teamId.description: Team ID to create user group in

name.description: Name of the user group

adminRights.description: Admin rights for the group if isAdmin is true

projects.description: Initial projects to assign to the group

members.description: Initial members to add to the group

tools.name: lokalise_update_usergroup
tools.description: Updates a user group's properties including permissions and assignments. Required: teamId, groupId, name, isReviewer, isAdmin. Optional: adminRights, languages. Use to adjust group permissions, modify access levels, or reorganize team structure. Returns: Updated group configuration. Note: Cannot modify projects/members here - use dedicated tools.

teamId.description: Team ID containing the user group

name.description: New name for the group

adminRights.description: Admin rights for the group if isAdmin is true

tools.name: lokalise_delete_usergroup
tools.description: Deletes a user group from a Lokalise team, removing all associated permissions. Required: teamId, groupId. Use for cleanup, removing obsolete groups, or restructuring team organization. Returns: Deletion confirmation. Warning: Removes all group assignments - members lose group-based permissions immediately.

teamId.description: Team ID containing the user group

tools.name: lokalise_add_members_to_group
tools.description: Adds users to a user group, granting them group-based permissions and project access. Required: teamId, groupId, userIds array. Use to onboard team members, assign role-based access, or batch permission updates. Returns: Operation confirmation. Members immediately gain group permissions and project access.

teamId.description: Team ID containing the user group

userIds.description: User IDs to add to the group

tools.name: lokalise_remove_members_from_group
tools.description: Removes users from a user group, revoking group-based permissions and project access. Required: teamId, groupId, userIds array. Use for role changes, offboarding, or permission cleanup. Returns: Operation confirmation. Warning: Immediate effect - users lose group permissions and project access.

teamId.description: Team ID containing the user group

userIds.description: User IDs to remove from the group

tools.name: lokalise_add_projects_to_group
tools.description: Adds projects to a user group, granting all group members access to specified projects. Required: teamId, groupId, projectIds array. Use to expand group project scope, onboard projects to existing teams, or batch project assignments. Returns: Operation confirmation. All group members gain immediate project access.

teamId.description: Team ID containing the user group

projectIds.description: Project IDs to add to the group

tools.name: lokalise_remove_projects_from_group
tools.description: Removes projects from a user group, revoking group member access to specified projects. Required: teamId, groupId, projectIds array. Use to limit project scope, offboard projects, or restructure access. Returns: Operation confirmation. Warning: All group members lose immediate project access.

teamId.description: Team ID containing the user group

projectIds.description: Project IDs to remove from the group

tools.name: listFields
tools.description: List all top-level GraphQL query fields with descriptions.

tools.name: listMutations
tools.description: List all top-level GraphQL mutation fields with descriptions.

tools.name: describeField
tools.description: Return the argument schema and return type for a top-level field. IMPORTANT: This does not show sub-fields of complex types. To discover the fields of a complex return type (e.g., 'Users'), use the 'introspectType' tool.

fieldName.description: Name of the top-level field to describe.

tools.name: describeComplexField
tools.description: Describes a top-level query or mutation field, its arguments, and its immediate sub-fields if it returns a complex object.

fieldName.description: Name of the top-level field to describe.

operationType.description: The type of operation: 'query' or 'mutation'. Defaults to 'query'.

tools.name: introspectType
tools.description: Discover the available fields for a complex GraphQL object type. Use this when a type name is returned from another tool (like 'describeField') and you need to know its internal structure.

typeName.description: The name of the complex type to inspect (e.g., 'Users', 'UsersResult').

tools.name: executeQuery
tools.description: Execute a GraphQL query string (and optional variables) and return JSON.

query.description: GraphQL query string.

tools.name: pg_analyze_database
tools.description: Analyze PostgreSQL database configuration and performance

tools.name: pg_debug_database
tools.description: Debug common PostgreSQL issues

tools.name: pg_manage_schema
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL schema - get schema info, create/alter tables, manage enums. Examples: operation="get_info" for table lists, operation="create_table" with tableName and columns, operation="get_enums" to list enums, operation="create_enum" with enumName and values

tools.name: pg_manage_functions
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL functions - get, create, or drop functions with a single tool. Examples: operation="get" to list functions, operation="create" with functionName="test_func", parameters="" (empty for no params), returnType="TEXT", functionBody="SELECT 'Hello'"

tools.name: pg_manage_triggers
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL triggers - get, create, drop, and enable/disable triggers. Examples: operation="get" to list triggers, operation="create" with triggerName, tableName, functionName, operation="drop" with triggerName and tableName, operation="set_state" with triggerName, tableName, enable

tools.name: pg_manage_indexes
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL indexes - get, create, drop, reindex, and analyze usage with a single tool. Examples: operation="get" to list indexes, operation="create" with indexName, tableName, columns, operation="analyze_usage" for performance analysis

tools.name: pg_manage_constraints
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL constraints - get, create foreign keys, drop foreign keys, create constraints, drop constraints. Examples: operation="get" to list constraints, operation="create_fk" with constraintName, tableName, columnNames, referencedTable, referencedColumns

tools.name: pg_manage_rls
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL Row-Level Security - enable/disable RLS and manage policies. Examples: operation="enable" with tableName="users", operation="create_policy" with tableName, policyName, using, check

tools.name: pg_manage_users
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL users and permissions - create, drop, alter users, grant/revoke permissions. Examples: operation="create" with username="testuser", operation="grant" with username, permissions, target, targetType

tools.name: pg_manage_query
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL query analysis and performance - operation="explain" for EXPLAIN plans, operation="get_slow_queries" for slow query analysis, operation="get_stats" for query statistics, operation="reset_stats" for clearing statistics

tools.name: pg_execute_query
tools.description: Execute SELECT queries and data retrieval operations - operation="select/count/exists" with query and optional parameters. Examples: operation="select", query="SELECT * FROM users WHERE created_at > $1", parameters=["2024-01-01"]

tools.name: pg_execute_mutation
tools.description: Execute data modification operations (INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE/UPSERT) - operation="insert/update/delete/upsert" with table and data. Examples: operation="insert", table="users", data={"name":"John","email":"john@example.com"}

tools.name: pg_execute_sql
tools.description: Execute arbitrary SQL statements - sql="ANY_VALID_SQL" with optional parameters and transaction support. Examples: sql="CREATE INDEX ...", sql="WITH complex_cte AS (...) SELECT ...", transactional=true

tools.name: pg_manage_comments
tools.description: Manage PostgreSQL object comments - get, set, remove comments on tables, columns, functions, and other database objects. Examples: operation="get" with objectType="table", objectName="users", operation="set" with comment text, operation="bulk_get" for discovery

tools.name: pg_export_table_data
tools.description: Export table data to JSON or CSV format

tools.name: pg_import_table_data
tools.description: Import data from JSON or CSV file into a table

tools.name: pg_copy_between_databases
tools.description: Copy data between two databases

tools.name: pg_monitor_database
tools.description: Get real-time monitoring information for a PostgreSQL database

target.description: Domain name, IP address, or CIDR notation to scan (e.g., example.com, 192.168.1.1, 10.0.0.0/24)

flags.description: Nmap scanning flags. Common options: -T4 (timing), -p 1-1000 (port range), -sS (SYN scan), -A (aggressive scan)

tools.name: create_entities
tools.description: Create multiple new entities in the knowledge graph

name.description: The name of the entity

observations.description: An array of observation contents associated with the entity

tools.name: create_relations
tools.description: Create multiple new relations between entities in the knowledge graph. Relations should be in active voice

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

tools.name: add_observations
tools.description: Add new observations to existing entities in the knowledge graph

entityName.description: The name of the entity to add the observations to

contents.description: An array of observation contents to add

tools.name: delete_entities
tools.description: Delete multiple entities and their associated relations from the knowledge graph

entityNames.description: An array of entity names to delete

tools.name: delete_observations
tools.description: Delete specific observations from entities in the knowledge graph

entityName.description: The name of the entity containing the observations

observations.description: An array of observations to delete

tools.name: delete_relations
tools.description: Delete multiple relations from the knowledge graph

from.description: The name of the entity where the relation starts

to.description: The name of the entity where the relation ends

relations.description: An array of relations to delete

tools.name: read_graph
tools.description: Read the entire knowledge graph

tools.name: search_nodes
tools.description: Search for nodes in the knowledge graph based on a query

query.description: The search query to match against entity names, types, and observation content

tools.name: open_nodes
tools.description: Open specific nodes in the knowledge graph by their names

names.description: An array of entity names to retrieve

tools.name: extract_locations
tools.description: Extract locations from text and add them to the knowledge graph as entities with geographic relationships

text.description: The text to extract locations from

sourceEntity.description: Optional: name of source entity that mentions these locations (creates 'mentions_location' relations)

tools.name: cryptoCategories
tools.description: Returns information about all coin categories available on CoinMarketCap.

tools.name: cryptoCategory
tools.description: Returns information about a single coin category on CoinMarketCap.

tools.name: cryptoCurrencyMap
tools.description: Returns a mapping of all cryptocurrencies to unique CoinMarketCap IDs.

tools.name: getCryptoMetadata
tools.description: Returns all static metadata for one or more cryptocurrencies including logo, description, and website URLs.

tools.name: allCryptocurrencyListings
tools.description: Returns a paginated list of all active cryptocurrencies with latest market data.

tools.name: cryptoQuotesLatest
tools.description: Returns the latest market quote for one or more cryptocurrencies.

tools.name: dexInfo
tools.description: Returns all static metadata for one or more decentralised exchanges.

tools.name: dexListingsLatest
tools.description: Returns a paginated list of all decentralised cryptocurrency exchanges including the latest aggregate market data.

tools.name: dexNetworksList
tools.description: Returns a list of all networks to unique CoinMarketCap ids.

tools.name: dexSpotPairsLatest
tools.description: Returns a paginated list of all active dex spot pairs with latest market data.

tools.name: dexPairsQuotesLatest
tools.description: Returns the latest market quote for 1 or more spot pairs.

tools.name: dexPairsOhlcvLatest
tools.description: Returns the latest OHLCV market values for one or more spot pairs for the current UTC day.

tools.name: dexPairsOhlcvHistorical
tools.description: Returns historical OHLCV data along with market cap for any spot pairs using time interval parameters.

tools.name: dexPairsTradeLatest
tools.description: Returns up to the latest 100 trades for 1 spot pair.

tools.name: exchangeAssets
tools.description: Returns the assets/token holdings of an exchange.

tools.name: exchangeInfo
tools.description: Returns metadata for one or more exchanges.

tools.name: exchangeMap
tools.description: Returns a mapping of all exchanges to unique CoinMarketCap IDs.

tools.name: globalMetricsLatest
tools.description: Returns the latest global cryptocurrency market metrics.

tools.name: cmc100IndexHistorical
tools.description: Returns an interval of historic CoinMarketCap 100 Index values based on the interval parameter.

tools.name: cmc100IndexLatest
tools.description: Returns the lastest CoinMarketCap 100 Index value, constituents, and constituent weights.

tools.name: fearAndGreedLatest
tools.description: Returns the latest CMC Crypto Fear and Greed Index value.

tools.name: fearAndGreedHistorical
tools.description: Returns historical CMC Crypto Fear and Greed Index values.

tools.name: fiatMap
tools.description: Returns a mapping of all supported fiat currencies to unique CoinMarketCap IDs.

tools.name: getPostmanCollection
tools.description: Returns a Postman collection for the CoinMarketCap API.

tools.name: priceConversion
tools.description: Convert an amount of one cryptocurrency or fiat currency into one or more different currencies.

tools.name: keyInfo
tools.description: Returns API key details and usage stats.

tools.name: create_onepager
tools.description: Creates a new OnePager in your organization. After creation, call update_onepager to populate fields, then publish_onepager. Example: {"onepager_name":"Acme","onepager_type":"fundraising"}

onepager_name.description: Display name shown in dashboard and builder

organization_uuid.description: Target organization UUID; defaults to your primary org

tools.name: create_board
tools.description: Creates a Board (curated list). location and description are required at creation.

organization_uuid.description: Target organization UUID; defaults to your primary org

tools.name: upload_image_from_url
tools.description: Fetch an image and upload via signed S3 URL. Use returned key in update_onepager (image_key, founders[].image_key, investors[].image_key).

url.description: Remote image URL to fetch

tools.name: update_onepager
tools.description: Update any OnePager fields. Typical flow: set short_description, links.web_url, founders[], image_key, category_uuids; then publish_onepager. Use list_categories to map category names to UUIDs.

tools.name: update_board
tools.description: Update board properties, curators, and tags. Wraps backend shape { update: { board, curators, tags } }.

name.description: Curator name

onepagerUuids.description: OnePager UUIDs to include under this tag

tools.name: publish_board
tools.description: Publish a board. If first publish, slug is required and must be unique; otherwise slug cannot change.

tools.name: check_board_slug
tools.description: Checks if a board slug is available (based on 404 for GET /boards/p/{slug}/valid).

tools.name: publish_onepager

tools.name: search_jurisprudence
tools.description:
Busca resoluciones judiciales en la base de datos de jurisprudencia del CGPJ (CENDOJ).
    
    DESCRIPCIÓN:
    Esta herramienta realiza búsquedas avanzadas en el repositorio oficial de jurisprudencia
    del Consejo General del Poder Judicial de España. Permite filtrar por texto libre,
    jurisdicciones, órganos judiciales, fechas, números de resolución y otros criterios.
    
    CASOS DE USO TÍPICOS:
    1. Búsqueda de jurisprudencia reciente sobre un tema específico
    2. Localización de resoluciones de tribunales concretos
    3. Análisis de tendencias jurisprudenciales en períodos temporales
    4. Búsqueda de precedentes judiciales para casos similares
    5. Investigación académica sobre líneas jurisprudenciales
    
    FLUJO DE TRABAJO:
    1. Ejecutar esta herramienta con los criterios de búsqueda
    2. Analizar los resultados devueltos (metadata + listado de resoluciones)
    3. Para obtener enlaces de descarga: usar get_document_info con los campos reference/optimize
    4. Para leer el texto completo: usar extract_document_text con los mismos campos
    
    PARÁMETROS PRINCIPALES:
    - texto: búsqueda de texto libre en contenido completo
    - jurisdicciones: filtrar por tipo de derecho (PENAL, CIVIL, CONTENCIOSO, SOCIAL, etc.)
    - tipos_organo: filtrar por tribunal (TRIBUNAL_SUPREMO, AUDIENCIA_NACIONAL, etc.)
    - fecha_desde/fecha_hasta: delimitar rango temporal
    - roj/ecli: búsqueda exacta por identificador único
    - orden: criterio de ordenación (fecha_desc recomendado para jurisprudencia reciente)
    - response_format: "markdown" para legibilidad o "json" para procesamiento
    
    EJEMPLOS DE BÚSQUEDA:
    1. Jurisprudencia reciente del TS sobre responsabilidad civil:
       texto="responsabilidad civil", tipos_organo=["TRIBUNAL_SUPREMO"], 
       jurisdicciones=["CIVIL"], orden="fecha_desc", resultados_por_pagina=20
    
    2. Sentencias penales de la AN del último año:
       jurisdicciones=["PENAL"], tipos_organo=["AUDIENCIA_NACIONAL"],
       fecha_desde="2023-01-01", orden="fecha_desc"
    
    3. Búsqueda por identificador ROJ específico:
       roj="STS 1234/2024"
    
    RESULTADOS:
    Cada resultado incluye:
    - Información descriptiva: título, ROJ, ECLI, fecha, órgano, sala, ponente, resumen
    - Campos técnicos necesarios para herramientas posteriores: reference, optimize, databasematch
    - Enlaces directos: documento_html (visualización web)
    
    PAGINACIÓN:
    - El campo 'tiene_mas' en metadata indica si hay más páginas
    - Use el parámetro 'pagina' para navegar (pagina=2, pagina=3, etc.)
    - Ajuste 'resultados_por_pagina' según necesidad (10, 20, 30, 50)
    
    FORMATOS DE RESPUESTA:
    - MARKDOWN (defecto): Formato legible para presentar al usuario
    - JSON: Estructura completa para procesamiento programático
    
    NOTAS IMPORTANTES:
    - Los campos 'reference' y 'optimize' son ESENCIALES para get_document_info y extract_document_text
    - Guarde estos valores si planea acceder al documento completo posteriormente
    - El campo 'databasematch' indica la base de datos origen (AN, TS, TSJ, AP, etc.)
    
    Args:
        ctx (Context): Contexto de ejecución MCP con métodos debug/info/error
        **raw_params: Parámetros de búsqueda (ver SearchJurisprudenceInput para detalles completos)
    
    Returns:
        str: Resultados en formato Markdown o JSON según response_format
        
    Raises:
        ValidationError: Si los parámetros proporcionados son inválidos
        HTTPStatusError: Si el CGPJ devuelve un error HTTP
        RequestError: Si hay problemas de conectividad con el portal

tools.name: get_document_info
tools.description:
Obtiene información completa y URLs oficiales de un documento judicial específico.
    
    DESCRIPCIÓN:
    Esta herramienta consulta el endpoint 'docinfo' del CGPJ para obtener las URLs
    oficiales (HTML y PDF) de una resolución judicial previamente identificada mediante
    search_jurisprudence. Es el paso intermedio necesario antes de descargar el PDF completo.
    
    FLUJO DE TRABAJO RECOMENDADO:
    1. Ejecutar search_jurisprudence para encontrar resoluciones de interés
    2. De los resultados, extraer los campos: reference, optimize, databasematch
    3. Usar esta herramienta con esos valores para obtener URLs oficiales
    4. Compartir las URLs con el usuario o usarlas en extract_document_text
    
    CUÁNDO USAR ESTA HERRAMIENTA:
    - Cuando necesite proporcionar enlaces estables a resoluciones judiciales
    - Antes de extract_document_text para verificar disponibilidad del documento
    - Para obtener la URL oficial de compartición del CGPJ
    - Para acceder a metadatos adicionales del documento
    
    PARÁMETROS REQUERIDOS:
    - reference: Identificador interno del documento (del campo 'reference' de search_jurisprudence)
    - optimize: Hash de validación (del campo 'optimize' de search_jurisprudence)
    
    PARÁMETROS OPCIONALES RECOMENDADOS:
    - databasematch: Base de datos (del campo 'databasematch' de search_jurisprudence)
    - roj: Identificador ROJ (del campo 'roj' de search_jurisprudence)
    - stats_query_id, start, links: Metadatos de tracking (de los campos correspondientes)
    
    IMPORTANTE - NO INTENTE CONSTRUIR LOS PARÁMETROS MANUALMENTE:
    Los campos 'reference' y 'optimize' son hashes internos generados por el CGPJ.
    SIEMPRE deben obtenerse de una búsqueda previa con search_jurisprudence.
    No intente construirlos a partir del ROJ, ECLI u otros identificadores.
    
    RESPUESTA:
    Devuelve un objeto JSON con:
    - share.url_html: URL pública para visualizar el documento en formato HTML
    - share.url_pdf: URL directa de descarga del PDF oficial
    - share.reference: Identificador interno del documento
    - share.roj: Identificador ROJ de la resolución
    - actions: Acciones adicionales disponibles (uso interno)
    
    EJEMPLO DE FLUJO COMPLETO:
    
    # Paso 1: Buscar resolución
    resultados = search_jurisprudence(texto="responsabilidad patrimonial", 
                                       tipos_organo=["TRIBUNAL_SUPREMO"])
    
    # Paso 2: Seleccionar una resolución del resultado
    resolucion = resultados[0]  # Primera resolución
    
    # Paso 3: Obtener URLs oficiales
    info = get_document_info(
        reference=resolucion.reference,
        optimize=resolucion.optimize,
        databasematch=resolucion.databasematch,
        roj=resolucion.roj
    )
    
    # Paso 4: Usar las URLs
    print(f"Ver documento: {info.share.url_html}")
    print(f"Descargar PDF: {info.share.url_pdf}")
    
    MANEJO DE ERRORES:
    - Si reference u optimize son inválidos: error de validación del CGPJ
    - Si el documento no existe: error 404 del portal
    - Si hay problemas de conectividad: error de red con mensaje descriptivo
    
    Args:
        ctx (Context): Contexto de ejecución MCP
        **raw_params: Debe incluir reference y optimize de search_jurisprudence
    
    Returns:
        str: Objeto JSON con URLs oficiales y metadatos del documento
        
    Raises:
        ValueError: Si faltan los campos requeridos (reference, optimize)
        ValidationError: Si los parámetros son inválidos
        RuntimeError: Si el CGPJ devuelve un error en la respuesta
        HTTPStatusError: Si hay errores HTTP al consultar el portal

tools.name: extract_document_text
tools.description:
Extrae el texto completo de una resolución judicial desde su PDF oficial.
    
    DESCRIPCIÓN:
    Esta herramienta descarga el PDF oficial de una resolución judicial del CGPJ y
    extrae su contenido de texto completo usando PyMuPDF. Soporta lectura incremental
    para documentos extensos mediante parámetros de paginación (offset y max_chars).
    
    FLUJO DE TRABAJO TÍPICO:
    1. Ejecutar search_jurisprudence para encontrar resoluciones
    2. Seleccionar la resolución de interés de los resultados
    3. Extraer los campos: reference, optimize, databasematch
    4. Usar esta herramienta para obtener el texto completo del PDF
    
    CUÁNDO USAR ESTA HERRAMIENTA:
    - Para análisis de contenido completo de resoluciones judiciales
    - Para extraer fundamentos jurídicos, hechos probados o fallos específicos
    - Para realizar búsquedas textuales detalladas dentro del documento
    - Para análisis comparativo de varias resoluciones
    - Para entrenamiento de modelos o análisis de corpus jurisprudencial
    
    PARÁMETROS REQUERIDOS:
    - reference: Hash interno del documento (de 'reference' en search_jurisprudence)
    - optimize: Hash de validación (de 'optimize' en search_jurisprudence)
    
    PARÁMETROS OPCIONALES:
    - databasematch: Base de datos origen (AN, TS, etc.) - recomendado
    - offset: Posición inicial para lectura parcial (default=0, inicio del documento)
    - max_chars: Límite de caracteres a extraer (default=None, documento completo)
    - response_format: "markdown" (legible) o "json" (estructurado)
    
    LECTURA INCREMENTAL (para documentos largos):
    Los documentos judiciales pueden ser muy extensos (>100.000 caracteres).
    Para evitar límites de contexto, puede leerlos en chunks:
    
    Ejemplo de lectura en chunks de 50.000 caracteres:
    
    # Primera llamada
    chunk1 = extract_document_text(reference=ref, optimize=opt, max_chars=50000)
    # chunk1.metadata.has_more = True indica que hay más contenido
    
    # Segunda llamada (continuar desde donde terminó la primera)
    next_offset = chunk1.metadata.offset + chunk1.metadata.chars_extracted
    chunk2 = extract_document_text(reference=ref, optimize=opt, 
                                     offset=next_offset, max_chars=50000)
    
    # Repetir hasta que has_more = False
    
    METADATOS DEVUELTOS:
    La respuesta incluye información importante sobre la extracción:
    - total_chars: Longitud total del documento completo
    - offset: Posición desde donde se empezó a leer
    - chars_extracted: Número de caracteres devueltos en esta llamada
    - has_more: True si quedan más caracteres por leer
    - num_pages: Número total de páginas del PDF original
    
    FORMATOS DE RESPUESTA:
    1. MARKDOWN (default):
       - Encabezado con metadatos del documento
       - Información de paginación si es lectura parcial
       - Texto completo extraído formateado
       - Indicaciones para continuar lectura si has_more=True
    
    2. JSON:
       - Campo "text": contenido extraído
       - Campo "metadata": objeto con todos los metadatos de extracción
       - Ideal para procesamiento programático
    
    EJEMPLO COMPLETO DE USO:
    
    # Paso 1: Buscar y seleccionar resolución
    resultados = search_jurisprudence(roj="STS 1234/2024")
    doc = resultados[0]
    
    # Paso 2: Extraer texto completo
    contenido = extract_document_text(
        reference=doc.reference,
        optimize=doc.optimize,
        databasematch=doc.databasematch,
        response_format="markdown"
    )
    
    # Paso 3: Analizar el texto
    if "responsabilidad patrimonial" in contenido:
        print("El documento trata sobre responsabilidad patrimonial")
    
    MANEJO DE CAPTCHAS Y LÍMITES:
    El CGPJ implementa protecciones anti-scraping. Si se detecta un CAPTCHA:
    - La herramienta devolverá un error descriptivo con la URL del PDF
    - Puede proporcionar esta URL al usuario para descarga manual
    - Espere unos minutos antes de reintentar
    - Como alternativa, use get_document_info para obtener la URL HTML
    
    NOTAS IMPORTANTES:
    - Los PDFs judiciales pueden ser muy grandes (varios MB)
    - La descarga y extracción puede tardar varios segundos
    - El texto extraído preserva la estructura del documento (párrafos, saltos de línea)
    - No se extrae formateo especial (negritas, cursivas), solo texto plano
    - Las tablas y elementos complejos pueden no extraerse perfectamente
    
    Args:
        ctx (Context): Contexto de ejecución MCP
        **raw_params: Debe incluir reference y optimize de search_jurisprudence
    
    Returns:
        str: Texto extraído del PDF en formato Markdown o JSON
        
    Raises:
        ValueError: Si faltan campos requeridos o si se detecta un CAPTCHA
        ValidationError: Si los parámetros son inválidos
        HTTPStatusError: Si hay errores HTTP al descargar el PDF
        Exception: Si hay errores al procesar el PDF con PyMuPDF
